New Records: Greece extended their perfect Nations League campaign with a 2-0 home win over Republic of Ireland, their fourth victory in the competition
Key Match Events: Anastasios Bakasetas scored the opening goal for Greece in the 48th minute
Petros Mantalos scored the second goal for Greece in stoppage time
Caoimhin Kelleher made four important saves in the first half for Ireland
Pre-Game Insights: Greece came into the match on the back of an emotionally charged 2-1 win over England at Wembley on Thursday
The match was held at Karaiskakis Stadium in Piraeus, Greece, with a packed attendance of 30,253 fans
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland's Caoimhin Kelleher was praised for his performance but couldn't prevent the loss
Greece's players and fans celebrated the victory, highlighting their strong mental strength
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw a minute's silence for Greece's former teammate George Baldock who recently passed away
The match was Greece's second consecutive win in the Nations League after their emotional victory over England
